page.title: 08LAW AND ORDER
page.content: Burglary is the most common serious crime in the village. It occurs more in the summer and near to Christmas. In the village the average number of break ins is about 3. They happen in many types of buildings. Holmes Chapel is near the M6 and is a prosperous area so it is an ideal target for thieves. Just about everybody who owns a car drives it too quickly. Road accidents vary according to the weather (on average about 70 per year). Victims of assaults are mainly old people. Young people tend to commit this crime. Suicides have been quite rare in the village. About 3_4 have happened in the past year. There are five policemen in the village who try to make it as safe as possible for everyone.
